meanings.definition: Excessive enthusiasm or zeal, especially for a particular cause or belief.
meanings.sent1: Her fanaticism for the local sports team was unmatched, as she never missed a game.
meanings.sent2: His fanaticism for collecting stamps led him to travel the world in search of rare pieces.
meanings.sent3: The level of fanaticism she showed for her favorite band was so extreme that she even named her pet after the lead singer.
meanings.sent4: His fanaticism for cleanliness was evident in every corner of his house, where not a speck of dust could be found.
meanings.sent5: The fanaticism of the crowd at the concert was palpable, with everyone singing along at the top of their lungs.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being fanatical.
meanings.sent1: The fanaticism of his devotion to his work was admirable, but sometimes overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: She was concerned about the growing fanaticism of the group, fearing it might lead to extreme actions.
meanings.sent3: The fanaticism of his love for chocolate was evident in the way he always had a stash hidden in his desk.
meanings.sent4: The fanaticism of her dedication to yoga was like a beacon of light in the busy city, inspiring others to join her.
meanings.sent5: The fanaticism of his commitment to environmental causes was unwavering, as he spent every weekend cleaning up local parks.
